intro: [WRONG START] Hieracium dentatum subsp. euryphyphyllomorphum, commonly known as the broad-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. The plant features basal rosettes of broadly ovate to lanceolate leaves with serrated margins. Its flowering stems bear yellow composite flowers, composed of numerous small florets arranged in a disk. The subspecies is characterized by its broader leaves and more robust growth compared to other members of the species.
